First time here...have passed this place many times and it is not hard to find, but it is located in a place that you can easily drive past and miss.   We decided based on Yelp reviews to try this place as we wanted something different.  

We started with a beet salad which was not bad, the portion was good for two people to share and it was very tasty.  We had the salmon and the Ribeye as these are dishes we like to try for comparison, the portion of the salmon was ok, it was not the biggest I have seen but also not the smallest, it was average.  The Ribeye was good but the piece did have a lot of fat so you were looking for the meat.  For the price it is very very close to almost not being worth it because the steak is not that thick and like I said, there was a lot of fat on it and it not the kind of fat that you can eat.

It was cooked well and we enjoyed our experience.  There is music there almost every night so the staff and ambiance were above the top.  It definitely made up for the food and I am not talking about the taste, I am talking about the fine line of price versus quantity.  

This is a place I would recommend for everyone to try at least once and leave your review on your experience.  Because of the selection of items on the menu, we will go  back again and bring some other folks with us so I can get their opinion and input on the food.

Again, quality was AWESOME, quantity was riding the line as far as portion but overall it was good.

I will see how this next visit goes and update, but I do recommend you try this place at least once.

Really nice place. Had the escargot, cheese plate, onion soup and all were amazing. They have vouvray by the glass which is always a plus. The menu has so many great sounding items. Service was good. Will be back.

Back for business lunch. Food was great...Service was excellant..
CONGRADULATIONS on turning a location where many restaurants have tried and failed into a winner. Can't wait to go back again!!!

Was excited to learn that a quality restaurant was finally opening at this spot on Sunset Road that has been many different restaurants over the years.  Dined there  Saturday evening, March 8. Nice to see that the place was busy with activity. But as soon as I walked in there was an overpowering smell of ammonia. I immediately said to myself that no matter how good the food was, I would never return. Well I guess I got used to the disinfectant smell while dining on fantastic food and wine. The margarita flat bread was outstanding (topped with fresh greens), and the steak au poive with pomme frites as close to what I've had in France. Our waitress deserves to be in the running of best waitress of 2014 (if such an award exists). 

There is an outdoor eating area and I am looking forward to returning there. My only suggestion is that they make this area "warmer looking" as the façade of the restaurant itself is not attractive. As Spring in Vegas arrives, an outdoor dining area will attract those who want to dine under the stars, and creating an inviting ambiance in which to do so would be most welcome!

I'm super excited to see the extensive menu for this place! I will definitely need to come back to try some of the dinner specials! They have a lot of fish dishes that sound wonderful! We were impressed with everything that we tried here! Service is quick and friendly.

My husband and I tried this restaurant about 4 days after it opened. In spite of a couple of minor hiccups which I attribute to newness I am giving this restaurant 5 stars. The food was delicious, the service very good, and the menu was inventive. 

Our waiter seemed new to the profession but was friendly and helpful. Other staff though seemed to be very experienced. I am fairly certain that will all even itself out. The décor was a little frenetic between it's ode to music, movies, France, and a little Titanic but I understand they did themed dinners at the restaurant at Lake Las Vegas so they may have something similar planned for this location.

We started with the escargot which came in a traditional garlic butter with an addition of tomatoes and bacon. Neither my husband or I had had it that way and it was delicious. My husband got the shrimp salad sandwich which was beautiful and light. I had the salmon in lavender sauce which quite honestly is some of the best salmon I have ever had. It was very savory and the pesto mashed potatoes were a perfect compliment. We finished up with crème brulee which had the added surprise of the custard being caramel. My favorite desert with the addition of my favorite flavor. Yum! 

I am very much hoping that Bernard's will break the curse of this location because I hope to enjoy many meals there and Henderson, if not Las Vegas is sorely in need of restaurants with affordable French cuisine.

Great neighborhood spot! They have a great wine selection and outdoor seating as well.  Their French onion soup and their bread n butter are perfection!  The other menu items I have tried, mainly salads and sandwiches have also been great. I really like that this restaurant would be a good fit for many different occasions - Lunch or brunch with family or friends or significant other, wine date, romantic dinner, etc. I also love that they have been very accommodating when bringing my little guy. Will definitely be back.

We ate here before and rated service and food a 4 but this time the service was just ok, calamari rubbery, rib eye steak had lots of grissel and very chewy. We tried but couldn't eat it. They took the entree off the check which was nice. Might try another time, hopefully it was just a bad night.

I went with the Hubs for dinner on April 25th. The staff was very welcoming and 
friendly. It's great when the manager comes over and does a table visit, to check 
on your dining experience. The food was delicious. I has sea bass and the 
Hubs had steak. The service was excellent and the food was plated 
beautifully. I look forward to a return visit!

A delightful dining experience!  I had calamari and marguerite flatbread.  My wife had gazpacho and Caesar salad.  All were creatively presented.  The baguettes were a welcome accompaniment.  The decor is interesting.  The only thing that was missing was a full bar; only wine and beer are available.  All in all, a hearty recommendation.

What a find.  Great lunch specials include soup of the day, salad with mixed lettuce,  great bread, Coffee is so good. The dinner menu is spectacular.  From Italian to 
Tajine .... Great service, really nice atmosphere.  Dessert to die for.

Nice ambiance and an amazing menu! Used to be out at Lake Las Vegas. Glad to find them again. Fabulous fine dining in a casual atmosphere at reasonable prices for superior quality food. Must come back on a regular basis!!!

Bernard's Bistro is a great little place with delicious California French food. The portions are reasonable and their side salad with exquisite dressing makes the visit awesome! The wait staff was very attentive and kind. Overall, a lovely find as new residents in LV!!
Excellent food and environment ! Had the crepes and creme brûlée. Was also entertained by the Sinatra wannabe. Would highly recommend you try it! Excellent service also!

Fairly disappointed. I ordered a burger and the flavor a didn't mesh well, at least to me. I ordered it medium rare and it came out medium well. The meat was dry. Service was decent, but nothing spectacular. Hugo was my server, and he asked me if my burger was good. I told him it was alright and expected him to ask what was wrong, but he didn't.  I wouldn't have been as disappointed if I had not paid $16 for a burger.

Please let everyone know this place is NOT closed! Chef Bernard sold the restaurant to a friend and it was renamed CBs Legacy, short for Chef Bernard's Legacy. Same menu, same decor, same staff! Don't stay away...it even uses the same phone number as before!

My wife and I went to Bernard's for her birthday and we were pleasantly surprised!   The staff were great and the entertainment even sang happy birthday to my wife. The food was incredible!   We would really like to keep this a locals secret but, once the word gets out, I think it will be difficult to get reservations during the week. Don't pass this place up. You will regret it if you do!

We came here for the first time and fell in love with the decor, staff, and of course food.  The live piano player also is a very nice enhancement to dinner!   We're coming back Saturday with two other people and will probably come back regularly.   Thank you for the great experience!

MY wife and I had dinner at Bernard's last night.  It has been a while so we tried new items.  It is one of our favorite local spots when we want a special dinner.  We were not disappointed.

The warm crusty sliced baguette they serve up front was nice and fresh.  The butter tasted sweeter than most so I'm not sure what brand they use, but it was very good.

My wife had French Onion Soup then the "Braised Chicken Mille Feuille, with mushrooms, garlic and artichokes topped with puff pastry and mustard fondue sauce."  The soup has a lot of onions and with a great full flavor.  The chicken was very tender and enjoyable.

I also had the soup then the "Tandoori Chicken in Curry Masala Sauce, Served with Basmati Rice, Vegetables, Maharazi and Gazpacho Shooter."  I'm not a fan of cold soups, but for Gazpacho, it was as good as any I've had.  I was expecting more of a traditional Tandoori flavor, but this was still excellent.  They grill it on flat skewers, with the chicken alternating with onion slices and red pepper.  The rice had a nice flavor, complimenting the chicken very well.  I'd love the recipe.  The basamati flavor was there, as one would expect.

One impressive thing Bernard's does well is the plating.  The prices are very reasonable, and the beautiful plating is typical of what one would only expect to see in a more expensive restaurant.  Good job.

All in all, we love the food, the service and prices.  Oh, since it was "Titanic" Thursday, they has the movie Titanic playing on a large screen TV.  They also had an excellent jazz guitarist playing.  He alone I'd so see just for his music set.

We love Bernard's Bistro!! What a fantastic restaurant! We love how close it is to our house and the food is generally fantastic. We particularly love the open-faced shrimp sandwich (I forget what it's actually called). We usually do lunch and love the ambiance, the staff, and supporting a very local spot. Keep up the great work!
Second time here within a week... Hugo ... The food... The company was awesome. Love this place. Love coming here with Dean... Love everything about Bernard's... Def... Coming back soon.

Amazing neighborhood spot! My husband and I ate here for dinner last night. We shared the escargot, he had the ribeye, I had the salmon. True to all reviewers, the pesto mashed potatoes were really good. 

I wasn't sure about the wine list, so after calling to ask a few questions, we decided to bring a bottle (corkage is $20).

The service staff was amazingly friendly and helpful; it really seemed like a team environment amongst them!

The live music was a bonus!

We'll surely be back! Thanks, Lynn, for ensuring we had a great date last night!

Pretty good overall. Husbands meatloaf was very good, barbecue sauce was overpowering. The veggies and mashed potatoes were excellent. 
The chicken and mushroom crepe was ok, not great. The side salad was beautiful. The service was very attentive. Nice addition to the neighborhood.
We absolutely love Bernard's. Food, staff and atmosphere are top notch. One of our favorite restaurants.

Finally!!!!! After many, many failed restaurants at this location over the past decade, I truly feel that Bernard's is the perfect place for this location  to be successful! Why do you ask, because the food was FANTASTIC! The attention to detail you get here,  from any appetizer, to entree, to desert is an experience you would expect from paying hundreds of dollars at a fine French restaurant on LV Strip. I swear, I was so happy with this quaint locals place that I know I will be back many, many times! 
FYI it's the same fabulous owner and restaurant as Bernard's at the beautiful Lake Las Vegas! Please go here.......they deserve to be open for a long time!
Food is amazing and delicious! Staff is very accommodating and friendly. We have been wanting to try this place for awhile and it didn't not disappoint! Highly recommend!!

Very accomodating for my teenage son with Autism.  They made him pasta the only way he will eat it.  My vegetarian husband was very satisfied with his crepes - the side salad was unexciting.  My artichoke soup was delish, as was the "Titanic" chicken and shrimp dish.  The garnish was a little skimpy but good.  Our server, Danny, served me my cappuccino like a bit of a show - very fun!  We will be back.

Came here for 14th wedding anniversary.  Not sure we will be returning.  This establishment is close to our house and the positive yelp reviews lured us in.  Expensive dinner for such poor service.  I started this review in the restaurant; we waited over 10 minutes for the server to pick up the check for us to pay....

While the food was very good, the establishment is a little kitschy to be classy.  If I have the most expensive thing on the menu, it better be amazing.  It wasn't.  Manager seemed to be hitting every table, but ours.  Perhaps, my mistake was the reservation through Open Table mentioning our anniversary.  That may scream, special occasion, likely not to return.  If we drop over $100 for dinner, it should make us want to sing when we leave.  This place just didn't do that for me.

After reading reviews about Bernard's it seemed like it would be a great place for dinner. The night we went in there was plenty of available seating but we were seated at a very awkward table that was more in the way if anything. The wait staff was friendly. The atmosphere was pleasant. The food was good, not really memorable. I'd probably stop by again for lunch.
Casual dining and excellent service.  Nice assorted menu.  A needed addition to the area.

The food reminds me of when i travel to parts of Europe. A beautiful presentation great flavors, the piano playing, the decor on the wall. Customer service is awesome, they make you feel special. The chicken dish is good and the tuna is delicious. Nice Wine selection.The food could make the cover of Bon appetit magazine.

Let's start with warm, friendly service when we walked in the door.  Very refreshing.   Nice decor, comfortable seating.   And you can tell it's fresh.  I had a salad that jumped off the plate with beauty and taste.  Don't miss the beet vinaigrette - sounds strange, tastes amazing.  The quiche Florentino melted in my mouth.  Will be back for sure.

This....YES! My wife got the Filet Mignon Lily. Literally one of the most perfect steaks I have ever tasted. I had the Rack of Lamb with Roasted Duck. I took my time savoring every bite of this. It was absolutely amazing. The atmosphere was very relaxed, yet "high end". It was Titanic Night, so the specialty dishes were inspired by those served on the Titanic. All the while, the Titanic movie was playing in the background. A very romantic and memorable experience. Rhonda and the rest of the staff provided excellent service. I cannot wait to go back.
Really Really excellent. Was recommended by friends. Best Eggs Benedict. The Hungarian Goulash is outstanding.

This place is so good. I love the atmosphere, soft live music , very friendly staff. I have been here twice now and each time I was very happy.  It's nice to dress up a bit and enjoy a really great dinner. I look forward to more visits to Bernard's.
Lost my reservation but luckily still found a table for us.   Got Rosy as our server (again).  She's fantastic

Spent a Saturday night dinner here and was pleasantly surprised.  Had the Caesar salad and the Ahi Tuna dinner and my wife had the Cannelloni and both were fantastic.   Nice wine selection, nothing super pricey but decent choices.  Finished with espresso and overall was a great experience.  Will definitely come back again!
Bernard's Bistro IS NOT CLOSED - JUST A NEW NAME - SAME GREAT FOOD AND MENU.Bernard died and it is now called CB's Legacy.  We had a fabulous brunch there Sunday May 22, 2016.

Dinner with my OG calls for a new and exciting foodventure. Perusing my bookmarks, Bernard's Bistro beckoned us. 

We arrived around 7pm and we were greeted warmly. They had live music playing and it was lovely and soothing. 

We were seated quickly and our server arrived at our table promptly. Service was the best I've encountered in a while. He anticipated all our needs, refills on bread and drinks were perfectly timed and he made great entree suggestions. I really appreciated that he wasn't shy about letting us know his favorites on the menu when we asked.

I ordered the seafood crepes and my friend ordered the chicken schnitzel. Both entrees were delicious. I couldn't get enough and the portions were incredibly generous for the price point.

Based on the exceptional service, beautiful ambiance and delicious food, I look forward to coming back soon. It's a great little date night spot in Henderson.

Everyone who lives in this area or has driven by it knows that this location is practically cursed. Every restaurant that has gone there has failed, and having been to several of them, I am not surprised why. I think this is the first place that has a real shot at being successful.

My boyfriend and I decided to try it since we live right down the street. They were lacking in a few places having just opened. The decor was all over the place, and they could use a few drapes and new upholstery on the furniture, but they clearly prioritized getting things right in all the right places. Bottom line: Great service and great food. I feel all their issues were mainly aesthetic.

We were immediately greeted by a friendly hostess who sat us at a booth, which made it feel like we were eating at real restaurant for the first time at that location (past establishments had failed at this minor detail from the get go).

A server came by and read us a few specials. She was very friendly and patient, as I wanted to try everything on the menu and couldn't decide what to order. I started out with their special for the day, the red sangria. Delish! Their menu listed open faced sandwiches, wraps, pastas, burgers, and entrées, all of which looked carefully crafted and unique to this restaurant. I eventually decided on the Casablanca Bogart Burger, which was deliciously complimented with goat cheese, a spicy sauce I can't quite remember the name of, and ratatouille. I would have taken a picture, but I dug into the burger so fast I'd forgotten to. It was beautifully presented and looked so good I couldn't wait. The boyfriend ordered just the club sandwich which was equally tasty. We finished off with the creme brûlée for dessert... And from then I swore I'd be back!

I don't really even Yelp that often, but this place is definitely worth it. It's only been a day but I have been telling all my friends and now I'm Yelping to try and keep this place alive. See ya at Bernard's! :)
